input_text:
Job Title: Engineer II, Manufacturing Engineering

Location: Hillsboro, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
US-Hillsboro OR

How will you make an impact?

The Operations Engineer is member of the Operations Engineering team at Thermo Fisher Scientific in Hillsboro, Oregon. Our factory produces low-volume, high complexity electron microscopy products for semiconductor designers and manufacturers to use in the creation and improvement of their products and manufacturing processes. The team is responsible for smooth introduction of new products into the field as well as the ongoing improvement of products and the processes used to manufacture and service them.

What will you do?

Work on New Product Introduction (NPI) projects as they transition from initiation through release according to Product Management Process (PMP).

Assist logistics and document management with Technical Product Documentation (TPD) and specification support.

Using available data, identify areas requiring sustaining projects for design and process improvements.

Capturing and analyzing data to generate valuable insights and trends

Complete component obsolescence projects on current and near end of life products.

Builds manufacturing process for new products and preventative maintenance plan for product support in the field. May design tooling required for manufacturing and service to meet cycle time and tool availability requirements.

Builds and delivers initial training to Manufacturing, Technical Support and Service personnel in new product build, test, install and repair procedures. Also, gives input for ongoing training for factory and field service engineers.

Critical issue interface for Global Technical Support team as the need arises.

Spend a portion of your day working in a clean room environment.

How will you get here?

Education

University degree in Mechanical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Manufacturing/Industrial Engineering or a combination of technical education and experience that demonstrates the required skills.

Experience

Experience crafting documentation, procedures, and engineering reports.Experience in analysis of data and basic experimental methods, test protocols, and procedures.Experience participating in technical multi-functional projects.Experience developing and deploying products into a manufacturing environment.1-2 years’ experience as an Operations Engineer, Process Engineer or similar subject area highly desirable.Experience with Practical Process Improvements (PPI) including cost reduction by workflow or design improvements.Experience in reviewing data and driving improvements that affect quality.Experience in Failure Analysis and Solving Complex problems.Planning, organizing, prioritizing, and goal setting.Detailed problem solving.Teamwork and partnership in multi-functional groups.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Experience with HTML and Scripting.Work independently on projects and tasks without supervision.Ability to work on highly sophisticated electro-mechanical equipment.

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 outstanding minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our exciting mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer!

Experience Level (if available): None
